title: Hayagriva Bibliography Format
description:
Schema for Hayagriva YAML bibliography files, a bibliography management format for the modern age.
https://github.com/typst/hayagriva/blob/main/docs/file-format.md

harry.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
harry.author: Rowling, J. K.

kinetics.title: Kinetics and luminescence of the excitations of a nonequilibrium polariton condensate
author: Doan, T. D.
Tran Thoai, D. B.
Haug, Hartmut
Mehta, Jiten
Kinnear, Eric
wwdc-network.title: Boost Performance and Security with Modern Networking

entry.title: Bibliography Entry
entry.description: A single bibliography entry with fields describing a work.

title.title: Title
examples: 'Rick Astley: How An Internet Joke Revived My Career'

examples.value: 'Rick Astley: How An Internet Joke Revived My Career'

author.title: Author
author.description: The person or people primarily responsible for the creation of this entry.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date of publication or creation of this entry.

parent.title: Parent Entry
parent.description: Entry in which the current entry was published, or to which it is strongly associated.

abstract.title: Abstract
abstract.description: The abstract or summary of the entry.
examples: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex...

genre.title: Genre
genre.description:
The type, class, or subtype of the item (e.g. "Doctoral dissertation" for a PhD thesis; "NIH Publication" for an NIH technical report).
Do not use for topical descriptions or categories (e.g. "adventure" for an adventure movie).

editor.title: Editor
editor.description: The person or people responsible for selecting and revising the content of the entry.

affiliated.title: Affiliated People
affiliated.description: People involved with the entry that do not fit `author` or `editor` roles.

call-number.title: Call Number
call-number.description: The number of the item in a library, institution, or collection. Use with the `archive` field.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: The publisher of the item. Can include name and location.

location.title: Location
location.description:
The location at which the entry is physically located or took place.
For the location where an item was published, use the `publisher` field instead.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: The organization at/for which the entry was produced.

issue.title: Issue
issue.description:
For an entry whose parent has multiple issues, this field identifies to which specific issue the entry belongs.
Also used to indicate the episode number for TV series.

volume.title: Volume
volume.description: For an entry whose parent has multiple volumes, parts, seasons, etc., this field identifies to which specific volume the entry belongs.

volume-total.title: Volume Total
volume-total.description: The total number of volumes, parts, seasons, etc., in the series that contains this entry.

chapter.title: Chapter
chapter.description:
The number of the chapter in the referenced work where this item can be found.
When the chapter itself is the item being cited (common if it has its own non-numeric title),
prefer using `type: chapter` for the entry while specifying the containing work's data as its parent.

edition.title: Edition
edition.description: The published version of the entry.

page-range.title: Page Range
page-range.description: The range of pages within the parent that this entry occupies.

page-total.title: Page Total
page-total.description: The total number of pages in the entry.

time-range.title: Time Range
time-range.description: The time range within the parent at which this entry starts and ends.

runtime.title: Runtime
runtime.description: The total runtime of the entry.

url.title: URL
url.description: The canonical public URL of the entry, which may include an access date.

serial-number.title: Serial Number
serial-number.description:
Any serial number, including article numbers, associated with the entry.
If you have serial numbers of well-known schemes like `doi`, you should put them into the serial number as a dictionary.
Hayagriva will recognize and specially treat `doi`, `isbn`, `issn`, `pmid`, `pmcid`, and `arxiv`.
You can also include `serial` for the serial number when you provide other formats as well.

language.title: Language
language.description: The language of the entry as a Unicode Language Identifier.

archive.title: Archive
archive.description: The name of the institution/collection where the entry is kept.

archive-location.title: Archive Location
archive-location.description: The location of the institution/collection where the entry is kept.

note.title: Note
note.description: A short markup, decoration, or annotation to the entry (e.g., to indicate items included in a review).

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: Publisher information - can be a simple string or an object with name and location.

entryType.title: Entry Type
entryType.description:
The media type of the entry. Often determines the structure of references.
Entry types are case-insensitive in Typst (first letter can be upper or lowercase).

parentOrArray.title: Parent Entry or Array
parentOrArray.description:
Parent entry/entries. Can be a single parent or an array of parents.
Multiple parents are useful when media is published in multiple ways.

affiliatedList.title: Affiliated People
affiliatedList.description: List of people involved with the entry in specific roles.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role of the person or people in relation to the entry.

names.title: People Involved
names.description: The name(s) of the person or people involved in the role.

roleType.title: Role Type
roleType.description: The role of an affiliated person. Must be one of the predefined roles (case-sensitive).

formattableString.title: Formattable String
formattableString.description:
A string that may run through a text case transformer when used in a reference or citation.
Can disable transformations on segments or the whole string.
Can include mathematical markup in dollars ($...$) and supports short forms.

verbatim.title: Verbatim
verbatim.description: If true, disables text case transformations. Preserves casing as it appears in source.

short.title: Short Form
short.description: A short form that a citation style can choose to render over the longer form.

person.title: Person
person.description:
A person with a name and optionally given name, prefix, suffix, and alias.
String format: "Last, First" or "Prefix Last, First, Suffix"
Prefix is auto-detected using BibTeX algorithm (consecutive lowercase words at start).

name.title: Family Name
name.description: The family/last name of the person (required).

given-name.title: Given Name
given-name.description: The given/first name of the person.

prefix.title: Name Prefix
prefix.description: The prefix of the person's name (e.g., "von", "van der").

suffix.title: Name Suffix
suffix.description: The suffix of the person's name (e.g., "Jr.", "III").

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: An alternative name or pseudonym for the person.

personOrList.title: Person or List of Persons
personOrList.description: A single person or an array of persons.

date.title: Date
date.description:
A calendar date in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM, or YYYY).
Can include sign prefix for years before 0000 (e.g., -0001 for 2 B.C.E.).
Year 1 B.C.E. is represented as 0000.

anyOf.description: ISO 8601 date format (YYYY-MM-DD | YYYY-MM | YYYY) with optional sign prefix.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description:
A timestamp within media content: DD:HH:MM:SS,msms (only MM:SS required).
Left-most denomination can overflow (e.g., "138:00" for 2h 18min is valid).
Format: [DD:][HH:]MM:SS[,msms]

timestampRange.title: Timestamp Range
timestampRange.description:
A range of two timestamps separated by a hyphen: start-end.
Each timestamp follows the timestamp format rules.

numericOrString.title: Numeric or String
numericOrString.description:
A numeric variable: one or more numbers delimited by commas, ampersands, or hyphens.
Can express single numbers or ranges. May contain negative numbers.
Can have non-numeric prefix and suffix (e.g., "S10-15").

url.title: URL
url.description: Canonical public URL of the entry, optionally with access date.

date.title: Access Date
date.description: The date when the URL was accessed.

serialNumber.title: Serial Number
serialNumber.description:
Any serial number including article numbers.
Can be a simple string/number or an object with well-known schemes.
Hayagriva specially treats: doi, isbn, issn, pmid, pmcid, arxiv.
Use 'serial' key for generic serial numbers when providing other formats.

language.title: Language
language.description:
Unicode Language Identifier (BCP 47 / ISO 639-1 based).
Format: language[-script][-region][-variant]
Examples: "en" (English), "en-US" (American English), "zh-Hans-CN" (Simplified Chinese in China)
Script uses title case (e.g., "Hans"), region uses uppercase (e.g., "US").
